key_points: Executive Producers (EPs) of the film 'Rust' have disavowed responsibility for the production, stating their role was limited to financing.
Allen Cheney, along with Emily Salveson and her Streamline Global finance company, emphasized their lack of involvement in day-to-day operations.
The tragedy on the 'Rust' set involved Alec Baldwin accidentally shooting cinematographer Halyna Hutchins and injuring director Joel Souza with a live round.
The production faced scrutiny for allegedly cutting corners and hiring non-union crew members.
Bondit Media Capital, named as a co-financier, actually loaned money against distribution collateral without having an equity stake.
The film was not bonded, indicating potential financial and management oversights.
District Attorney Mary Carmack-Altwies has not ruled out Alec Baldwin as a person of interest in the investigation.
Financial arrangements for 'Rust' involved sales of North American distribution rights and foreign presales totaling $3 million.
Emily Salveson and Ryan Donnell Smith have a background in financing through tax incentives and have been involved in other productions.
'Rust Movie Productions LLC' ownership includes Cheney and Donnell Smith, with operational ties to Thomasville Pictures.
spokespersons: Allen Cheney (Speaking on behalf of the Rust production)
